title: Tips on how to get out of bronze
body: I play mainly jungle some tips would help a lot

replies.body:
I looked you up, and you hardly play ranked, and you hardly play jungle...

When you do play jungle you play udyr.

You need to farm more, you need to focus on objectives. If you guys group and team fight (which wont happen till late gold/plat, and even then it rarely happens), if you win you need to focus on objectives.

You need to work on killing turrets, dragons not as important imo, but you can get it, since youre udyr and youre the jungler, so you need to be setting up for objectives like dragon/baron.

Imo, dont bother with baron unless youre in a call with your other teammates as their response time coming to baron will be so long that its more worth it for you to go for towers instead.

Always keep lanes pushed. 

Udyr specific, dont go devourer, go runic or warriors, but never go devourer. 

Dont focus on ganking too much, focus on farming.

Other junglers I'd recommend for you to get out of bronze/silver:

{{champion:131}} {{champion:104}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:113}} {{champion:102}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:72}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:106}} 



if you have any other questions I can help you set up rune pages/mastery pages, if youre actually serious of getting out of bronze I could help you personally (add you in game and spectate you).
PLAY MASTER YI, IGNORE YOUR TEAM FOR THE MOST PART AND FOCUS MAINLY ON FARMING AND OBJECTIVES, AND WARD SHIT.  GG
Pray to the league gods that you don't get the usual group of autistic monkeys as team mates every game.
Duo with me and wait for Rengar to get enabled again.

Stop being bad.

Jokes aside we need a bit more information than "I play jungle".  What does your champion pool look like?  What is your best champion?  What other roles do you play?  What's your usual rune/mastery setup and why?

We could give you the same generic tips you can find with a quick google search, but those likely won't help you very much.  Since no one on here has likely played with you and remembered it we need a bit more information before we can actually try to help.

> [{quoted}](name=redniwediS,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vbEP6AEQ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-04-12T19:12:19.637+0000)
>
> Stop being bad.
> 
> Jokes aside we need a bit more information than "I play jungle".  What does your champion pool look like?  What is your best champion?  What other roles do you play?  What's your usual rune/mastery setup and why?
> 
> We could give you the same generic tips you can find with a quick google search, but those likely won't help you very much.  Since no one on here has likely played with you and remembered it we need a bit more information before we can actually try to help.

Well when I play jungle I play udyr, Yi (if I have to I hate Yi), and Amumu. I'm looking to expand my champion pool. I can't really say who my best champ is though.

1. create a new account and farm to 30, hoping your qualifiers go better.( getting placed into silver itself is even loads better than bronze, the average player isn't any better tbh, but aside from silver 5, theres less trolls, toxicity, etc, allowing you to improve better) joking, but not really, it worked for me, then I remembered all the things I bought were on this account and I switched back.
2. find a friend to help you.
3. never play jg or support, pick up a adc or mid/top that can honestly carry games, that way running into the toxic sludge of bronze will ruin fewer games.( not saying some support/jg mains cant climb, but it is a lot harder as a support player to climb )
4. play normal til next season and when its qualifiers time, go into it with a trusted duo partner.
5. get some kind of team speak, I don't use it myself, but from what ive been told, even the ability to quickly communicate with one member of your team has a great impact.

all things that will help aside from technical gameplay itself
